title: (x) Mediterranean Towers semiserif - Usenet {Angel}
content:
Hi Folks,

Anyone have any ideas about this one? I have started running out of ideas about where to look for this.

Thanks,  
- Mike

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [MedTowers.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105075037/http:/typophile.com/files/MedTowers.gif) | 13.9 KB |

 [‹ 20's and 30's font ?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105075037/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33547 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Tired of Waiting All Day" bold serif face - Adobe Garamond {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105075037/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33681 "Go to next forum topic")
author: bowfinpw

comments.content: Don’t panic... I think I know this one: [Usenet](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105075037/http:/www.dafont.com/usenet.font?text=Mediterranean).

Wow! I’m impressed. I’ve been noticing how many of these oddballs you seem to get. You must spend a lot of time in ’font backwaters’.

I’ve looked over the Apostrophic Lab fonts many times over the years, and have written to, and gotten samples from, several of the designers, but I can’t recall them as well as you seem to be able to do.

Thanks.

- Mike Yanega
I always double-check IDs before I credit, but there’s a very limited numbers of IDers whose skills I trust so much that I feel I don’t need to do that with their IDs. Angel is one of them.

By the way, it turns out that font was designed in 2000 by one of our members, Alejandro Paul, now of Sudtipos, and Veer’s Umbrella Type.

- Mike Yanega
Huh? Alejandro Paul? Wait a minute. ALEJANDRO PAUL? At Dafont? Where did you read that? Not that I don’t believe you, Mike, but want to read more of it …

I downloaded the font from TypOasis, which has a whole collection of the [Apostrophic Lab](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105075037/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/lab/index.htm) fonts. The font info file itself credits ’Alejandro Paul & Apostrophic Labs’. I believe that ’Apostrophe’ knows Alejandro.

I also did some Google searches with ’Usenet and Alejandro’ and found a number of results linking them. (I was dubious at first too.)

- Mike Yanega
